definition: to drive in reverse/fig. to take a backward step/retrogressive/trying to turn the clock back

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: The administration has turned the clock back with its new plans for education.
sentences.chinese: 政府实施新的教育计划，其实是开倒车。

sentences.english: She backed the car through the gate.
The rollback of reform is already putting off private western investors.
sentences.chinese: 改革开倒车已经让西方的个体投资商心生疑虑。

sentences.english: He was backed into by a careless driver this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨他被一个粗心大意的驾驶员开倒车时撞着了。

sentences.english: The new regulations will put the clock back by 50 years.
sentences.chinese: 新的规章是开倒车，要退回50年前的水平。

definition: to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
argument/view (sometimes derogatory)
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
double standard
political correctness/politically correct
to politicize
lit. to cut all at one stroke (idiom); to impose uniformity/one solution fits a diversity of problems/one size fits all
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
to turn back/to backtrack/(fig.) to revert to the former way of doing things
to do less well than before/to make a concession/setback/backward step/leeway/room to maneuver/fallback
to attack (verbally or in writing)
old road/familiar way/beaten track/conventional behavior
unilateralism
to fall back/to go in reverse
things are not as good as they used to be
